content: urban shells beanie katherine crombie newborn size this beanie is feminine and simple to make it has instructions for three sizes and the length is easy to alter it stretches a lot due to the front-post double crochets which create the ridges and while you are working it up it will look smaller than its actual size if you have never done front-post double crochets before they are easy to master and i have included instructions this beanie matches my scarf pattern urban shells available for free on www ravelry com and on www abeautifulramble blogspot com suggested yarn i recommend bendigo woollen mills luxury 8ply one 200g ball is enough for two adult size beanies and a toddler sized one your favourite 8ply however should be more than adequate sizes newborn 0-3 months toddler 6 months-2 years adult hook 4 00mm approximate yarn required for the three sizes approximately 80metres for the newborn size 120metres for the child size and 150metres for the adult size gauge the diameter of the first three rounds when beanie is unworn should be 6cm 2 3/8 inch adult size all instructions use american abbreviations chain = chain slip_stitch = slip_stitch sk2st = skip two stitches single_crochet = single_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet fpdc = front-post double_crochet how to do a front-post double_crochet a front-post double_crochet is made just like a double_crochet the only difference being that instead of inserting your hook under the top two loops of the stitch you are working into you put the hook around the post of the stitch 1 yarn over same as you do at the start of a double_crochet 2 insert the crochet hook from front to back and back to front around the indicated stitch 3 yarn over and draw up a loop 3 loops on the hook 4 yarn over and draw a loop through the first two loops on your hook 2 loops on hook 5 yarn over and draw through the last 2 loops on your hook 1 loop left **if these written insturctions are confusing a good picture tutorial can be found here http //www crochetspot com/how-to-crochet-front-post-double-crochet-fpdc/ instructions top of the beanie all sizes round 1 tie a knot and ch3 work 12dc into the third chain from the hook the one closest to the knot join with a slip_stitch in the top of the first double_crochet round 2 ch2 2dc in same st *2dc in next st repeat from * join with a slip_stitch in top of first double_crochet 24dc round 3 ch2 double_crochet in same st 2dc in next st *double_crochet in next st 2dc in next st repeat from * join with a slip_stitch in top of first double_crochet 36dc round 4 ch2 double_crochet in same st double_crochet in next st 2dc in the following st *double_crochet in each of the next 2 stitches 2dc in next st repeat from * join with a slip_stitch in top of first
